item.title: More deep dangerous potholes, 8th February
item.description:
All I can say is…my poor car. Why aren’t these getting repaired when reported. This could potentially cost someone their life. The students use the scooters on a regular basis. Just say one of them got thrown off into the path of a car?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another strip of deep wide potholes, 8th February
item.description:
More potholes. Continuously seeing drivers drive on the wrong side of the road to avoid these. If cars are doing that just imagine what it’s like for bikes and scooters. It’s so dangerous. I am in fear of hitting a cyclist because they just swerve out in front of you. Shocking state of affairs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 300 meters of deep wide potholes., 8th February
item.description:
300 meters of deep potholes that have been continuously reported by others and yet they are still there. I drive for a living and my car can’t take much more. It’s ridiculous and I will be claiming the next time my tyre gets punctured or my car gets more damaged. This issue has been there for weeks. It’s not good enough.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 8th February
item.description:
Fly tipping 2x carpets plus a few other items. Location what 3 words: plus.bluffing.bagels

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A38, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 8th February
item.description:
On the mini roundabouts by Tyler Creed - increasingly getting worse day by day! Try getting the contractor to seal the patches - they will last longer. Remember, the cheapest contractor isn’t always the best!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Road Edge, Narrow Lane, 8th February
item.description:
The road leading to Cleeve Common Car Park is covered in potholes with this part of the road being particularly bad. The edge has completely crumbled away and made the road even narrower. Needs to be passed with extreme caution!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The flooding at this location is getting worse, 8th February
item.description:
B4634 near the crossroads to the B4063. I reported this previously and nothing has been done. It’s nothing to do with being overwhelmed by rain. It’s just continual standing water, getting deeper. When are you going to get the location pumped. It’s a hazard to cars, pedestrians and bikes. Your responses to previous reports literally don’t hold water. Why is this issue not a priority.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
5 metres from junction of Manor Park/Chargrove lane

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chargrove Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several huge potholes, 8th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Sunken Drain, 8th February
item.description:
Coming down Crickley hill, and on the new section of road that has been opened within the last week, is a drain that has sunken and the tarmac has broken up. It is not possible to take a photograph of the issue as it is not safe to do so.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath ruined, 8th February
item.description:
All round the meadows is a public right of way. This is now in passable in many places due to the grazing earlier in the year. There is about 6 inches of mud and you sink further making about 50% of the area not accessible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway flooded and surface damaged, 8th February
item.description:
The path way around half of the field is flooded under at least 1cm of water or more all at the back of the school, there is a pool feeding the drain constantly and this has also flooded across the path, the bottom corner of the path is under at least 3cm of water and all the way round the path there is flooding and surface damage where the path has been washed away. The rest of the field badly needs path and even the playground entrance is under water as there is no connecting path

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 8th February
item.description:
Multiple potholes in the 1st and 2nd lane between junction 10 and 9, one in lane 2 is a significant size .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Developing pothole , material being expelled on pavement, 8th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Branch Hill Rise, Cheltenham
